medical_history.chief_complaint: Cramping abdominal pain localized to the RUQ, nausea, and emesis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started 7 days ago with bilateral cramping abdominal pain in the hypogastrium, which was accompanied by nausea and nonbloody, non-bilious emesis starting 3 days ago. Over the subsequent 24 hours, the pain localized to the RUQ, was constant, and lasted longer than 4 hours on the day of presentation. Multiple episodes of pain occurred since the onset. The patient also experienced chills without fever and ongoing watery diarrhea, which was noted to be not unusual for her.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diverticulosis, Uterine fibroids, Diabetes Mellitus, Bipolar disorder, Liver cyst, Hypertension, Dyslipidemia.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with Diabetes Mellitus, still alive at an unspecified age.
